thread.title: Pablo Zabaleta backs Claudio Bravo to succeed at Manchester City despite dismal start to life in England
thread.title_full: Pablo Zabaleta backs Claudio Bravo to succeed at Manchester City despite dismal start to life in England

author: David McDonnell
title: Pablo Zabaleta backs Claudio Bravo to succeed at Manchester City despite dismal start to life in England
text:
Sport Pablo Zabaleta backs Claudio Bravo to succeed at Manchester City despite dismal start to life in England Bravo was brought in from Barcelona with a high reputation last summer but has made a series of errors this season Share Claudio Bravo was partly culpable for Huddersfield's opening goal at the Etihad on Wednesday night (Photo: AFP) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Blunder keeper Claudio Bravo has been backed to come through his current nightmare by Manchester City team-mate Pablo Zabaleta. 
Bravo, ousted as City's first-choice keeper by Willy Caballero, was at fault for Huddersfield'a opener in Wednesday's 5-1 FA Cup win for Pep Guardiola's side. 
Chile keeper Bravo was mocked by his own fans after allowing a shot from Harry Bunn to squirm under him at the Arribas Stadium. 
It was the ninth time Bravo has conceded from the last 14 shots he has faced, but City boss Guardiola continued to back him afterwards, hailing the 33-year-old as one of the top five goalkeepers in the world. Read More Pablo Zabaleta has backed Bravo to turn his City career around (Photo: REUTERS) The Chilean has struggled since his transfer to City from Barcelona last summer (Photo: PA) 
City defender Zabaleta, who scored in the win over Huddersfield, also lent his support to Bravo and said Guardiola's players will rally round their under-fire team-mate 
"We know Claudio, itâ€™s not easy when you come to England," said Zabaleta. "It's different league. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
